member.name: T:AJP.JsonElementExtensions
member.summary: Methods which allow the addition or removal of properties on a JsonElement. JsonElement is immutable, so these methods work by enumerating the existing properties and writing them into a new jsonstring in memory. Additional properties can be added and existing properties can be removed and the resulting string is parsed into a new JsonElement which is returned. Please note this roundtrip process happens for every call, so if lots of changes are needed, please consider/test using ParseAsJsonStringAndMutate() so that all changes can be done together, with only one roudtrip process. A new JsonElement is returned, the original is unchanged.
